intro: Argythamnia gentryi, commonly known as Gentry's argythamnia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. It is adapted to arid environments and has hairy leaves to reduce water loss. Its botanical features make it a unique species of interest in ecological and botanical studies.
